newsitem.title: USA: U.S. probe suggests life possible on Jupiter moon.
newsitem.headline: U.S. probe suggests life possible on Jupiter moon.

text.p: New pictures of Jupiter's moon of Europa, taken by NASA's Gaileo probe, suggest life could exist there, scientists said on Friday.
Pictures taken by the probe, which flew within 430 miles (692 km) of Europa on Dec. 19 revealed massive ice floes stretching tens to hundreds of miles (km) long and scars from ice-spewing volcanos.

The features provide evidence that water, heat and organic compounds may have combined to create an environment suitable for the start of life, Galileo scientists told a news conference at NASA's Washington headquarters.
"I think Europa is an excellent laboratory for the existence of possible life," said Jim Brown, a planetary scientist at Brown University in Rhode Island. "It's got the ingredients."
Scientists are eagerly awaiting Galileo's closer look at Europa. It will pass within 364 miles (587 km) of the moon on Feb. 20.
Galileo, which was launched in 1989 and arrived at Jupiter in 1995, is making a two-year tour of Jupiter.
